caption:
This photograph captures two men standing outside, engaged in a discussion over a large architectural plan they are both holding and examining. The man on the left is older, with combed gray hair, wearing glasses, a dark suit, a red tie, and a white shirt. The man on the right is balding, also wearing glasses, and dressed in a dark suit with a patterned tie and a white shirt.

The scene is set against an urban backdrop featuring a brick building with modern architecture that includes large, dark-framed windows. In the background, other individuals, presumably business professionals based on their attire of suits and ties, are seen interacting. There are also a couple of cars parked nearby.

The atmosphere appears to be serious and business-like, with a focus on the task at hand, which likely involves discussions related to building or development plans. The day is overcast, contributing to the subdued lighting of the photograph.
title: Exhibit at the first symposium on low pollution power systems development held at the Marriott Motor Inn, Ann Arbor. Vehicles and hardware were assembled at the EPA Ann Arbor laboratory. Part of the exhibit was held in the motel parking lot. Mr. William Lear (left), developer of the Lear steam bus, and Mr. David Miller, of the Monsanto Corporation, look over designs during break in symposium.
